request.description:
API end point to login into Trio cloud platform. The authorization client details has to be base64 string encoded before sending as request.

Ex:- Javascript

btoa('my-trusted-client:123456');

Above script would return the data as 'bXktdHJ1c3RlZC1jbGllbnQ6MTIzNDU2' which has to be sent to the request header as follows:

Authorization: Bearer bXktdHJ1c3RlZC1jbGllbnQ6MTIzNDU2

You can upload live photos to this endpoint. Like document upload, files must be uploaded as a multipart form. Valid file types are jpg, png and pdf. The file size must be between 32KB and 10MB. Live photos are validated at the point of upload to check that they contain exactly one face. This validation can be disabled by setting the advanced_validation argument to false.

formdata.description: The possible values are front and back

request.description: Documents are uploaded using this endpoint. Along with the file upload the relevant document type must be specified. Documents must be uploaded as a multipart form. The valid file types are: jpg, png and pdf. The file size must be between 2KB and 3MB.

formdata.description: The possible values are front and back

request.description: Documents are uploaded using this endpoint. Along with the file upload the relevant document type must be specified. Documents must be uploaded as a multipart form. The valid file types are: jpg, png and pdf. The file size must be between 2KB and 3MB.

formdata.description: Defaults to true. Validates that the live photo contains exactly one face.

request.description: You can upload live photos to this endpoint. Like document upload, files must be uploaded as a multipart form. Valid file types are jpg, png and pdf. The file size must be between 32KB and 10MB. Live photos are validated at the point of upload to check that they contain exactly one face. This validation can be disabled by setting the advanced_validation argument to false.

formdata.description: Defaults to true. Validates that the live photo contains exactly one face.

request.description: You can upload live photos to this endpoint. Like document upload, files must be uploaded as a multipart form. Valid file types are jpg, png and pdf. The file size must be between 32KB and 10MB. Live photos are validated at the point of upload to check that they contain exactly one face. This validation can be disabled by setting the advanced_validation argument to false.

toNodeType Accepted Values: [ACH-US, CARD-US, INTERCHANGE-US].

*targetNodeType is always the nodetype of the external node (irrespective of whether it is from or to node).
**fromNodeId is basically the Trio Account. So the input for specifying the same is "-ta-".

exec: var flagged_reason = "Early user | Transfers out (within 3 weeks)";
early users flagged  should be address with flagged_reason "Early user | Transfers out (within 3 weeks)" and user id
it will take around 8 minutes to return a transaction from synapse side

item.description:
As Finch Customer Support, I want users who have transferred funds in and transferred funds out (within 3 weeks of opening their account) to be flagged to be reviewed, so that I can review the account

User is flagged to be reviewed when all of following criteria is met
-User account is less than 3 weeks old
-User has "transferred funds in" and "transferred funds out"

exec: Verify whether previous transaction is settled with the synapse side
console.log("This transactions is not yet settled. still on "+jsonData[i].transactionStatus+" State.")
var flagged_reason = 'Returned transaction after it initially settled';
Returned Trasactions flagged  should be address with flagged_reason "Returned transaction after it initially settled" and user id
it will take around 8 minutes to return a transaction from synapse side

item.description:
As Finch Customer Support, I want users who have had transaction statuses changed to 'returned' within 3 days of being 'settled'.

User is flagged to be reviewed when following criteria is met
-User must have had a transaction status changed to returned within a 3 day period after initially being settled (regardless of whether it is a transfer in or transfer out).

request.description:
API end point to login into Trio cloud platform. The authorization client details has to be base64 string encoded before sending as request.

Ex:- Javascript

btoa('my-trusted-client:123456');

Above script would return the data as 'bXktdHJ1c3RlZC1jbGllbnQ6MTIzNDU2' which has to be sent to the request header as follows:

Authorization: Bearer bXktdHJ1c3RlZC1jbGllbnQ6MTIzNDU2

exec: console.log("Pre-request Script ----- Deposit Flows | ACH-Bank Login")

**fromNodeId is basically the Trio Account. So the input for specifying the same is "-ta-".

request.description:
API end point to login into Trio cloud platform. The authorization client details has to be base64 string encoded before sending as request.

Ex:- Javascript

btoa('my-trusted-client:123456');

Above script would return the data as 'bXktdHJ1c3RlZC1jbGllbnQ6MTIzNDU2' which has to be sent to the request header as follows:

Authorization: Bearer bXktdHJ1c3RlZC1jbGllbnQ6MTIzNDU2
